column3: UK Met Office MetDB AMDARS message
UK Meteorological Office. MetDB AMDARS data, [Internet]. British Atmospheric Data Centre, 2008, Date of citation. Available from http://badc.nerc.ac.uk/data/ukmo-metdb
2009-05-11 15:40:41 : File created. 64278 data lines written to file.
AMDARS messages from the UK Met Office metDB. Archived at the BADC using the BADC-CSV format. The metdb_short_name field indicates the
data entity name used within the Met Office's metDB system and documentation, while the metdb_code_table field is the corresponding metDB code table reference
code table comments have been taken from UK Met Office metDB documentation
metdb_header_tag gives version number for header information, date this header version came into use and metDB message type to which it applies

column13: Actual Location in tenths of a minute
column14: Referenced to checkpoint in tenths of a minute

column15: KARS US AIR FORCE (ARGOS COMMUNICATIONS CENTRE, LANDOVER, MD)

column3: Type of aircraft data relay system

ASDAR (ACARS also available but not operative)
column7: ACARS (ASDAR also available but not operative)

column4: Type of instrumentation for wind measurement

column3: Type of instrumentation and original units for wind measurement (measured in m/s unless otherwise indicated)
Code table 002002 is a 4 bit BUFR flag (bit). Bit 1 is the high order bit.
example uses: 0 means no bits set - i.e. none of the flag values are valid or not known
4 means bit 2 only is set  - i.e. originally meansured in knots
12 means bits 1 and 2 set - i.e. originally measured in knots by a certified instrument
8 means bit 1 is set - i.e. measured by certified instrument in m/s
A value of -9999999.0 means that the Met Office haven't been informed what the type of instrument was/is used for measurements.
In these cases they make judgement based on the WMO block number whether to convert from knots to m/s or not
